description: Number of rooted noncrossing trees with n nodes such that root has degree 1 and the child of the root has degree at least 2.
links: M. Noy, Enumeration of noncrossing trees on a circle, Discrete Math., 180, 301-313, 1998.
Index entries for sequences related to rooted trees
formula: a(n) = (19*n-31)*binomial(3*n-8, n-4)/(n-1)/(2*n-3); G.f.: (1-2*z)*2*sin(arcsin(sqrt(27*z)/2)/3)/sqrt(3*z).G.f.: g^3*(3-2*g) where g*(1-g)^2 = x. - _Mark van Hoeij_, Nov 09 2011From _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Mar 06 2013: (Start)a(n) = binomial(3*n-5,2*n-3)/(n-1)-2*binomial(3*n-8,2*n-5)/(n-2), n>2.a(n) = sum(i=1..n-3, (binomial(3*i-2,2*i-1)*binomial(3*(n-i-2),2*(n-i-2)-1))/ (i*(n-i-2))).  (End)
author: _Emeric Deutsch_
